name: Belford Brewing Company
description: A one-barrel nano-brewery at Campbell's Junction in the Belford section of Middletown, NJ. Open on Fridays and Saturdays with a well-rounded selection of beers.

name: Belgian Mare Brewing
description: The Belgian Mare Brewery is currently under construction in East Alstead, New Hampshire. Our opening is projected for the fall of 2013. Please stop by and take a look at what we are doing!

name: Bell's Brewery, Inc.
description: Bell's Brewery, Inc. began in 1985 with a quest for better beer and a 15 gallon soup kettle. Since then, we've grown into a regional craft brewery that employs more than 200 people over an 20 state area, in addition to Puerto Rico and Washington DC. The dedication to brewing flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers that started in 1985 is still with us today. We currently brew over 20 beers for distribution as well as many other small batch beers that are served at our pub in Kalamazoo, the Eccentric Cafe. Our ongoing goal is to brew thoughtfully, creatively and artistically. We strive to bring an authentic and pleasant experience to all of our customers through our unique ales and beers.

name: Belle Isle Restaurant and Brewing Co
description: The Belle Isle Restaurant & Brewery, located in the heart of Northwest Oklahoma City, is a favorite for lunch, dinner and entertainment. Enjoy a menu of pastas, burgers, pizzas, and more. Then there's the Beer! We at the Belle Isle Brewery are proud to create the finest handcrafted beer available, using the best ingredients and strict German Brewing rules. We've developed an excellent selection of beers now available for take out. Our pub features a daily happy hour and live music.

name: Bellevue Brewing Company
description: Bellevue's first production brewery specializing in small-batch, handcrafted ales and lagers! We will be utilizing a 20BBL brewhouse with 160BBLs of fermentation capacity.    Although we don't intend to be an organic brewery, we will use organic ingredients whenever possible and, once food service begins, our menu items will feature organic ingredients as well. A children's menu will also be offered.    Our goal is to showcase the wonderful flavors of Washington with local food and brewing ingredients...keeping it local is good business!    We'll also feature a new Washington State wine each month and provide two guest taps for our craft brewing colleagues to showcase their beers.

name: Bellows Brew Crew
description: Bellows moved from Waunakee to Watertown in December 2001. Their new location sports a ten-barrel brewhouse in the front window, and a pool table in the back. I'm told their building will allow them to triple their ground-level floor space, and there's also a huge banquet-type room on the second floor, and a ballroom on the third, so watch for some major expansion here in the future.

name: Bellwether Hard Cider Company
description: Bellwether Hard Cider is owned and operated by Cheryl and Bill Barton.  We started the business in 1999, inspired by travels through the cider regions of France and after years of “research and development” as home cidermakers.  We started our business with the simple goals of making fine artisanal ciders and to lead the revival of a great American tradition.    We started operations in an old Babcock chicken hatchery building on Route 96 in Ithaca, New York.   In 2003 we built a new building on Route 89 in Trumansburg, New York, and planted an orchard of European cider varieties. We have been an active member of the Cayuga Lake Wine Trail for over 5 years.  At present, we produce around 10 varieties of hard ciders, ranging from very dry to semi-sweet, some with carbonation and some still.

name: Bellwoods Brewery
description: Bellwoods Brewery is a new Toronto microbrewery, retail store & café coming to Ossington and Argyle early in 2012    We intend to produce a diverse range of craft ales and fermented elixirs for both wholesale and retail customers.    Bellwoods Brewery will also operate a small indoor picnic-style cafe in collaboration with local chefs for lovers of craft beer.

name: Belly Love Brewing Company
description: Why Belly Love?    Well... it's hard to put into words the thoughts that led to the name, because so much of it is simply the feeling you have when you consume a carefully, dare I say lovingly, crafted beer. Complex and simple at the same time. Satiating but refreshing. Nourishment for your senses. Quite plainly; beer is liquid soul food.    We feel that beer makes bellies happy and shows them love. So... raise a glass, love your belly; Belly Love!

name: Belmont Brewing Co
description: The Belmont Brewing Company opened in 1990 and is Southern California's oldest operating brewpub. Come by for a taster set of award-winning ales crafted by Head Brewer Blackwell. We serve classic American fare with international flair and the warmest customer service around.

name: Below Grade Brewing
description: In 1992 Dean Wise made his first batch of beer. Things went well--at least nothing blew up. . . and the beer was, um, beer--but he wanted something more. Dean went from using a brew kit to creating his own recipes with shocking amounts of the best malts and hops. Some questioned his sanity, but the result was exceptional beer everyone loved. Having dedicated part of his basement to a brewery, when it came time to name his burgeoning business, Below Grade Brewing was a natural fit.

name: Below the Radar Brewing Company
description: Below the Radar is Huntsville’s first Micro-Brewhouse situated in the Historic Huntsville Times Building in the recently stablished “downtown entertainment district”. Below the Radar opened its doors on August 2012 and has been expanding its lunch and dinner menu of goodness as well as its micro-brews & drinks ever since.Below the Radar is a great place to have lunch or meet after work for socializing with friends and co-workers. BTR is known for its one of a kind variety of micro-brews, extensive wine list and liquor drinks or its wonder array of food by its own in-house Chef Bill Harden. BTR menu items include like roast beef sliders topped with cilantro-horseradish sauce. And how about some Lazy Magnolia Southern Pecan Ice Cream for dessert!  Enjoy live music every Tesday night to make it a night to remember.    BTR is open 7 days a week for lunch & dinner (including a very special “Chef Bill Brunch” on Sundays). Be sure to check out the Chef Dish Pick of the Week.    BTR has thirty-two beers on tap including 7 craft brews made in-house, more than 27 bottled beers.    BTR has a Full bar and a great selection of fine wines. Be sure to check our Wine Pick of the Week.    An upscale, yet relaxed, and nonsmoking atmosphere.

name: Beltane Brewing
description: We are a start-up brewery and beer cafe located in Novato, CA (Marin County).  We are not open yet, however!  Planned opening date is on Bastille Day, July 14, 2012.  Please click on the Brewers Blog or contact us and stay in touch with our progress towards opening.    We proudly produce artisinal small-batch ales for the discerning consumer.  The cafe  will also offer chartucerie, cheese plates, pannini and snacks, sourced from local producers.

name: Beltway Brewing Company
description: Beltway Brewing Company is a brewery in Sterling, Virginia (Loudoun County, a Washington D.C. suburb) built exclusively as a host for partner brewing, contract brewing and production of private label beers. The mission of Beltway Brewing Company is to professionally produce high quality craft beer for those who cannot build or expand their own breweries.    Brewing operations started in September 2013 and the Tasting Room is expected to open in Spring 2014.

name: Bemidji Brewing Company
description: Bemidji Brewing Company LLC is a small craft brewery based out of the beautiful city of Bemidji, MN. Craft beer is our passion, and we hope to provide the freshest, most high quality craft beer to Bemidji and the northwoods.

name: Benchmark Brewing Company
description: Benchmark Brewing is all about delicious beer, beer that we want to take home and drink. We want consistently awesome beer that you can rely on to be the gold standard of the style.  Our year round beers are low in alcohol and high in flavor; we often find that it is nice to be able to enjoy a beer or two and keep your wits about you.  We also know that there are times when a ten percent beer is just what you need to keep you warm at night; to that end we will celebrate the seasons, months, weeks, or whatever we feel needs celebration with specialty releases that will vary wildly in alcohol content and style.  No matter the style or strength all Benchmark Beer will set the standard for its kind.

name: Bend Brewing Company
description: Bend Brewing Company overlooks the Deschutes River at Mirror Pond in Bend, Oregon. Locally owned and operated, this exceptional brewpub opened its doors in February of 1995 and quickly became a favorite for locals and visitors alike. The people of the B.B.C. take pride in creative, award-winning handcrafted brews, fresh and flavorful menu selections, a casual and friendly atmosphere and superb service.    Bend Brewing Co. is a great place to have lunch, dinner or just some hot nachos and cold handcrafted beer after a day skiing or hiking in Central Oregon's recreational paradise.  In the summer, B.B.C.'s patio is the best place in town to dine outside. In the winter, come in and warm up with a malty seasonal ale.   Come and see for yourself why we're the locals' favorite!

name: Benson Brewery
description: Cradled in the heart of Benson on Omaha’s north side - you will find Benson Brewery, a cozy neighborhood brew-pub welcoming all who look for friendly company, good conversation, house made beers and solid drinks. We believe a bar is what its patrons and community make it, which is why we serve true, locally sourced foods when possible, well-crafted brews, and drinks to please all.    The Benson Brewery is a pub for all times. From its reclaimed wooden flooring, to its warm interiors, modern brewery, and exposed brick walls – Benson Brewery is a place without pretense. Our food, our drinks, our service and our space are inspired by old and new American traditions. We welcome all to come and feel at home in our brewery, a Benson Local

Our 30-barrel brewery and Duluth’s first production brewery taproom, The Bent Tap, is expected to open in Winter / Spring 2013. We are excited to use the amazing water of Lake Superior along with the talent of our brewers to make some of the freshest, tastiest and most dependable craft beer possible.

name: Bent River Brewing
description: Unique neighborhood brewery restaurant in "old" downtown historic district. We offer the midwest's best award- winning craft beers, a great selection of pub grub and one of the coolest beer gardens in the Quad Cities.

name: Bentley Brewing Company
description: Thank you for your interest in Bentley Brewing and the Dark Horse Tavern. This is a family owned pub and brew house located at 12 Crane Street in Southbridge, Ma. Our goal is to offer a warm and inviting atmosphere where you can savor our array of freshly brewed beer on tap. We also offer a fully stocked bar for those wishing a more exotic cocktail. To accompany these libations we have a delectable selection of pub fare for your enjoyment.    As we gear up for the Dark Horse Tavern's grand opening in mid-June, Bentley Brewing, along with the help of our expert brew master, Tim Daley, will begin production of our four signature beers on tap. In subsequent weeks, we will be expanding our offerings to include four additional beers, as well as two cask ales, which will complete our on-site brewing selection.    Located just off Main Street in Southbridge, we are within easy access to major routes I-84 and the Mass Pike. Parking for over 150 cars and handicapped accessible, we offer outside dining on our spacious patio overlooking the scenic Quinebaug River, multiple large flat screen televisions broadcasting the latest sporting events throughout the bar, gaming options that include championship dartboards and a pool table, and live entertainment on Saturday evenings. You can also look into our brewing area where all the magic happens and Tim would be happy to answer any and all questions and we welcome your suggestions for future offerings. We accept reservations to accommodate parties of 30-70 guests in our conference room that includes a private bar and optional catering.    We are confident that after experiencing our locally grown and freshly prepared food, our fantastic brew and the exceptional service of our dedicated staff, you will make Bentley Brewing and the Dark Horse Tavern your favorite destination spot. We look forward to welcoming you and your guests in person at our riverside location at 12 Crane Street.

name: Berghoff Brewery, Inc
description: Berghoff’s history as a beer brand goes back over 120 years, and in that time it has developed a reputation of high quality and consistency. The first batch of Berghoff beer was brewed in Fort Wayne, Indiana in 1887 by Herman Berghoff and his three brothers. Herman’s desire to expand the market for the family’s beer led him to sell the product at the Chicago World’s Fair where it received high acclaim. Since then, Berghoff has continued its success and relevance in the Chicago market and beyond.                  As the craft beer market has evolved, the brand has received fresh, exciting updates. Berghoff changed its brewing location and is now proudly brewed at Point Brewery in Stevens Point, Wisconsin. Berghoff has also refreshed itself with updated recipes and packaging. With consulting from brewing experts Randy Mosher and John Hannafan, Berghoff’s new, top-notch beers are ready to satisfy consumer demand. As the brewery looks to the future, Berghoff beer will continue to evolve as trends change, but will always maintain its roots as an authentic German-style brew whose history and tradition will never be forgotten.

name: Berkshire Brewing Company
description: Berkshire Brewing Company Inc. is a regional brewery located in South Deerfield, MA, established in 1994 by Christopher T. Lalli and Gary A. Bogoff, a pair of homebrewers with the vision of being Massachusetts’ local brewery. Our goal is to produce clean, fresh, well-balanced ales & lagers in small batches. At the present time we are capable of producing 580 barrels (17,980 gallons) of fresh beer each week. All of our beer is unfiltered, unpasteurized and contains no chemical additives or preservatives. As craft brewers, we are now producing nine styles of beer year round and seven seasonals.

name: Berryessa Brewing Company
description: Berryessa Brewing Co. is a 20 barrel craft brewery located just outside historic Winters, California. We take pride in producing fresh quality beer available for wholesale or to enjoy at our taproom.    The tap room is located at the brewery, a relaxed atmosphere in a country setting. There we have indoor seating, scenic outdoor seating, games, occasional entertainment, good company and most importantly, excellent fresh beer. We offer full pints, half pints, and sample trays. More often than not, you will find cask conditioned and barrel aged beers drawn off a cask engine exclusively at the tap room. You can also purchase 64 oz. growlers to go of any of our six rotating taps filled with a counter pressure growler filler.

name: Berthoud Brewing Company
description: Berthoud Brewing Co. is a locally owned craft brewery in Berthoud, Colorado. Our brewery is dedicated to produce authentic beers that represent the unique experiences of our friends, family, and community.

name: Bertrams Salmon Valley Brewery
description: Bertram’s Salmon Valley Brewery, like the town from which it derives its name, is situated in the heart of the beautiful northwestern Rocky Mountains on the River-of-No-Return. Salmon is the portal to the largest wilderness area in the contiguous United States, the Frank Church Wilderness.     Once the center of an active mining, logging and ranching community Salmon has probably been the West’s best-kept secret. However, following the centennial of the Lewis and Clark expedition, this haven for recreationists is fast becoming a popular tourist destination.

name: Berwick Brewing
description: Berwick Brewing is dedicated to providing the highest quality, full-flavored, drinkable, Ales & Lagers with only the highest quality ingredients. Our commitment to freshness and character reflects in each glass. With over 50 years combined experience, we understand what our customers seek in quality brewing and world class products.

name: Beryl's Beer Co
description: Beryl's Beer Co. is dedicated to delivering high quality barrel aged beers to the local community.

name: Bessemer City Brewing
description: Bessemer City Brewing is located just 25 miles west of Charlotte on I85 near the base of Crowders Mountain in historic Bessemer City. The beer is currently brewed and served in the Whisky Mill Bar & Grill known locally for its excellent eats, rubs & sauces. BCB’s focus is to brew high quality craft beer in the style of beers from the United Kingdom & Ireland. We celebrate the pride of our city’s culture and history by naming our beers after original city founders, industries & landmarks.

name: Beta Brewing
description: Established in 2008 by founder, owner, and brewer, K. Kasner as a one man, one barrel operation. We intend to launch our beer in local markets this year (2012) and hope you'll hop on board.

name: Bethlehem Brew Works
description: Established on April 15, 1998 by the Fegley Family, Bethlehem Brew Works successfully captured the essence of Bethlehem's steel industry in a 250 seat brewpub. Signature beers include Steelworkers' Oatmeal Stout, Valley Golden ale, and the award winning Fegley's ESB. In addition, three seasonal taps have been frequented with beers ranging from Pale Ales and Wheats to Pumpkin Ale and Belgian Lambics. Accompanying the six beers brewed right in the restaurant is a full bar specializing in single malt scotches, small batch bourbons, and specialty martinis. Open seven days a week, BBW offers lunch and dinner featuring many items which incorporate the handcrafted beer into their recipes. Golden Ale Hummus, Beer and Cheese Soup, Brewschetta, Diamond Plate Pork, and Beer-Marinated Portabella Napoleon are just a hint of what the menu has to offer.

name: Bettler Brewing Company
description: Bettler Brewing Company, LLC is a brewpub in planning. We are currently looking for a permanent location in the Lake Norman area of North Carolina just north of Charlotte.

name: Bevog
description: Bevog microbrewery is the fruit of inquisitiveness and aspiration towards discovering new beer-drinking experiences; it is the result of enthusiasm, love and zeal. We brew beers with character and soul. Our goal is to transcend the limits of the known and ordinary.    We have had enough of a monotonous beer offer and the belittling of beer. Beer can be and is much more than that. Bevog brewery is dedicated primarily to beers of top fermentation, more commonly known as ales. The ales we brew basically originate from England. In the last few decades this highly diverse type of beer has been given greater breadth, a wider range of flavors, has been shifting the boundaries of individual styles and becoming more and more popular around the world. It is gaining popularity not only with beer lovers and beer drinkers, but in general with gourmets, top chefs and people who are always willing to explore new flavors and experiences and who care about what they ingest.

name: Beyond The Pale Brewing Company
description: Beyond the Pale was started as a small neighbourhood brewery by three local guys who grew up, went to school, and currently reside in the neighbourhood. Equipped with an old 400L brew system and a belief that there was room in the market for somebody wanting to make a variety of full flavour, unique beers, we embarked on our journey in early 2012. The concept was simple: make a variety of beers that WE wanted to drink and create a tasting opportunity for our customers to come into the brewery to decide what they liked, and buy to go.    During our first year of operation we released over 20 different beers, underwent one expansion, and our MO remains the same as it was in the beginning. In addition to the retail store our beers can also be found in over 30 local bars and restaurants.    You can be sure when you pick up a glass or bottle of our beer that you’re drinking a fresh local product. We work that little old brew house like a pack mule to crank out as much beer as possible. Nearly all of our beer is sold to customers within a week of leaving our brite tanks. That’s freshness that’s hard to find elsewhere.

name: Bier Brewery & Taproom
description: The Bier Brewery and Taproom is excited to be one of the newest breweries in Indiana.  We are committed to the highest quality and best tasting bier in Indianapolis.  Our small size allows BIER to have the utmost control over the many different variables that go into brewing a batch of beer.

name: Bierbrauerei "Zum Lamm" Karl Ege GmbH & Co.
Bierbrouwerij De Koningshoeven
description: The abbey opened a brewery inside the monastery in 1884 in order to finance the monastery and contribute to charitable causes. Despite this goal, the brewery was run as a commercial enterprise. The abbey owned several bars in the area and produced lager under its own "Trappist" brand as well as contract brewing for several private labels. In 1969, the abbey licensed the brewing operations to the Artois Brewery (now InBev). In 1980 the deal with Artois ended, and the monks went back to brewing themselves, this time a top fermented beer which had only been made in limited quantities since the 1950s. Over time the brewery introduced more varieties, first with Dubbel and Tripel in 1987, then in 1992 they introduced Blond. Between 1993 and 2000, the brewery also marketed a brand called Enkel. The brewery also produces the world's only Trappist witbier. The brewery also used to produce the Jopen beer.

name: Bierbrouwerij St.Christoffel
description: Beerbrewery St. Christoffel is a relatively young brewery, founded in 1986. Our brewery is situated in the former coalmining-town Roermond in Dutch Limburg and named after the patronsaint of Roermond: Saint Christoffel. The brewery started very small and was at first situated behind a house. In 1995 the brewery moved to her present facility. With moving there, the brewingcapacity greatly enhanced due to new brewing-, fermenting- and lagerfacilities. Christoffel brews according to the German Reinheitsgebot von 1516: which means the brewingprocess takes place in a completely natural way. Around the year 1990, Christoffel Blond was awarded 3 years in a row with the Dutch title: Best Beer from the Netherlands.

name: Biercamp
description: Seasonal varieties of artisan sausage, bratwurst, hot dogs, jerky, bacon, pickled items, nano brews and more hand made fresh in-house.

name: Bières de Chimay
description: The Chimay Brewery is a Belgian brewery founded inside Scourmont Abbey, in the Belgian municipality of Chimay in 1862. The brewery produces three widely distributed ales and a patersbier exclusively for the monks; they are known as Trappist beers because they are made in a Trappist monastery. The brewing plant was updated in 1988, and as of 2005 produced 120,000 hectolitres annually.    Since 1876 the monastery has also made cheese, and currently offers four cheeses.

name: Bierwerk Afrikan Ales
description: Bierwerk is situated in the Western Cape at the very tip of Africa, we strive to produce ales with a distinct African profile using local ingredients and getting inspiration from the culture and tradition of the great continent.    Southern Africa has an environment and climate which bring about a wide range of exceptional flavors. The intricate cultural and culinary traditions provide us with great inspiration for our innovative ales.    There are thousands of indigenous plants which will only grow in the countries in southern Africa. We utilize this great and diverse resource to produce beers with unique flavors. South Africa is also home to a thriving hops industry and vast areas of farm land producing a plethora of grains.    Many of our ales are fermented with a special blend of yeast (including wine yeast, ale yeast, and naturally occurring microbes) which provides complexity and a rustic character. Being unpasteurized, unfiltered and bottle conditioned with live yeast our ales has delicious mouth feel and great often ageing potential.

name: BierWerks Brewery
description: German Style Brewpub with a great outdoor patio.  Always the place to stop on the way back from a day of skiing.

name: Big Al Brewing
description: To share the passion for brewing and the love of beer that we celebrated as home brewers.    We're proud to offer six year-round beers; a traditional irish red, a chocolatey smoked porter, a session pale ale, dry-hopped IPA, an amber just to pair with pizza and an ESB created to celebrate the passion of our very own Emerald City Supporters.

name: Big Alice Brewing
description: In late 2012, Big Alice will arrive in Long Island City as one of its first breweries since Prohibition offering small batch, handcrafted, high quality beers to the neighborhood utilizing local and organic ingredients whenever possible. We look forward to turning pounds of grain into gallons of beer.

name: Main Brewery - Bed & Breakfast
description: Big Axe is a Brewery and Bed and Breakfast in a small town, Nackawic, New Brunswick.

name: Big Bay Brewing Company
description: At Big Bay Brewing we believe that life on the water is a little sweeter. And that sweet life is infused in every beverage we create. To us, life on the water means creating and savoring memories and moments that are cherished for a lifetime. And what better way to enhance those memories and moments than with the right beverage to sip and savor.     The founders of Big Bay have a strong fundamental belief that craft brewed beverages and life on the water go hand in hand. Alone, what we drink is just sustenance, but paired with the right sights, sounds and settings, it becomes part of a much larger experience. And we are dedicated to bringing the “experience” back to brewing. After all, our personal life experiences have played a leading role in developing Big Bay Brewing. And as we grow, we invite you to be a part of Big Bay by sharing your experiences with us. In other words, we want you to be a part of the sweet life with us.

description: We here at Big Daddy's have been pouring our beer since September of 2008, we are fairly new and fresh. The variety of beers we brew here are all unfiltered leaving in all the good stuff most breweries take out, so that means are beers are better for you (HA,HA). We also have a variety of entertainment at Big Daddy's on the weekends and some weekdays you just need to check the calendar for who's playing and when. name: Big Dog's Brewing Company

name: Big E Ales
description: Our unique, cozy and family-friendly brewpub is tucked away in a small industrial park in Lynnwood, WA. We have been at this location producing our handcrafted ales since 2005. We take pride in serving our patrons more than just a quick beer or a bite to eat; we want to build friendships that go beyond the bar. Beer to us is something that bonds and brings people together from all walks of life. We specialize in transforming your events and parties either at our brewery or your home into an impressive beer experience. Our dispensing systems are not only innovative and efficient, they will enhance your party and will impress your guests…they will be talking about the amazing beer and the cool “party pig” long after your party. name: Big Muddy Brewing Co
description: All over the United States, craft breweries are continuing an American tradition which experienced an almost 50 year drought after the repeal of prohibition. Big Muddy Brewing in Murphysboro, Illinois is much like many of these new “microbreweries” all over the country, reinvigorating an industry and continuing a heritage that has skipped several generations.  Until 1940, Murphysboro was the home of a thriving brewery and until prohibition; it was one of the cornerstones of the town’s industry. In 1910, the Stecher Brewing Company produced more than 40,000 barrels of beer a year. However, passage of the Volstead Act in 1919, which ushered in the era of prohibition, began a slow decline to the brewery’s demise.  Big Muddy Brewing’s founder Chuck Stuhrenberg attended Southern Illinois University Carbondale in the 1980s. After graduation, he opened a franchise of Chicago’s Rosati’s Pizza in Carbondale and in 1990, began another venture, Spray Shield Industries.  It was while Stuhrenberg was in college at SIU that he began making his own beer.  Stuhrenberg and his college buddies would homebrew, and as the years went on, he began to take his hobby more seriously.  Stuhrenberg always had professional brewing in the back of his mind, but it stayed a hobby until 2009. In July, 2009, Big Muddy Brewing finally began production, the first brewery in Murphysboro in over 50 years.  The first beer offered by Big Muddy Brewing is Kinkaid Wheat. It was a recipe popular with Stuhrenberg’s family and friends. It was also something he felt would be a good “craft beer transition brew” for those used to the conventional corporate brew (BMC).  Kinkaid Wheat is currently offered on tap and by bottle in bars, restaurants and liquor stores across Southern Illinois alongside of Big Muddy Brewing’s second selection, “Saluki Dunkel Dog”, a dark, amber/dunkel style beer.  The third and newest addition to Big Muddy Brewing’s lineup is an ale called “Big Muddy Pale Ale”, and future varieties include “Logan’s Lager”.

Malts from Canada, England and Germany have been hand pick to produce a strong base in our brews. Hops, like grapes, are influenced by the territory, so if a beer style calls for hops from Germany we get hops from Germany. We love our ingredients so much we are planting our very own Hop yard at the Phillips Farm in Manotick, there we will grow specialty hops exclusively for our local brews. Our heritage yeast is housed in a special yeast laboratory to ensure the consistency and freshness of our brews. Our water is double filtered and boiled to give us a “clean slate”, and to finish it off we adjust the natural flavor compounds in the water to suit our various beer styles.    Good ingredients are the start of a great brew…    We use time honored and perfected brewing traditions that have been passed down from brewmaster to brewmaster for centuries. These methods are steeped in artisan spirit and have the precision of science. Using these methods, with our state of the art brewing system allows us to produce hand crafted beers that are pure, free of added chemicals and preservatives, full of flavor and rich in character.   Generations of brewers have combined their knowledge to bring you this pint  Passion for the craft of beer is in every batch we make. Our brewmaster makes beer because he loves beer. The satisfaction of a job well done is confirmed with the good times, new friendships and community that is formed around sharing a great pint.    For the Love of Beer

description: Beer is an art and Drive Beer knows it well. Starting from this assumption, in 1999 The Tarricone Family takes over a factory, built in the '80es upon instruction of HM the Prince of Windisgraetz of the Austrian Family of Furstenberg who then bought the Prinz Brau Group. Later, in the '90es, this latter was acquired together with the Birra Moretti Group, by the Labatt Group.  In the next years, the Moretti-Prinz Brau Group was acquired by Interbrau and eventually by Heineken.  The entire know-how and the workers themselves have been kept by Drive Beer, thus assuring a continuity in the excellence of the brands produced. Precisely, in the first years of 1900, the ancestor Giuseppe Tarricone owned several vineyards and produced an excellent wine. He was producing and selling his wine all across the inland of Lucania transporting it on his picturesque chariots drawn by horses.   He then moved the company office to Atella (PZ), and then to Bella (PZ), and eventually, bewitched by the beautiful landscape and the extraordinary nature of the surroundings of Muro Lucano (PZ), he settled down, together with his entire family of Corato origins, he married a Muro Lucano girl, whose name was Concetta Bianchini.  Therefore, when in 1999 the Tarricone Family was suggested by Gerardo, one of the sons of the ancestor Giuseppe Tarricone, to take over the Brewery, belonging to the Heineken Group, it was almost physiological to the five brothers, Giuseppe, Vito, Carlo, Federico e Fabrizio, who at that time were expanding their businesses linked somehow to the food and beverages sectors, to accept this "challenge", which represented for the Tarricone Family a "return to the origins".  The Drive Beer, an industry of the national market, has managed to impose itself as a beer pole, entirely Italian, competing with the most famous multinational companies. name: Black Creek Historic Brewery
description: Black Creek Historic Brewery recreates the techniques, tools and recipes used by brewers in 1860s Ontario. Our Brewmasters do everything by hand on a small scale. It's a great place to learn about beer because, unlike a modern commercial brewery, you can see every step in the process for yourself. And, no one else has a Brewmaster ready to welcome visitors in period costume.    In the 1860s there were 155 registered breweries in Ontario, and countless smaller operations. Black Creek Historic Brewery is the first in this province to replicate the brewing processes of that era, when there was no electricity or refrigeration, no stainless steel tanks or bottling plants.    The equipment at Black Creek Historic Brewery is made mainly of wood and copper, and the beer ferments the way it was done in the old days, with wooden barrels to age the beer. Malted barley is shoveled by hand into the wort tun where it is boiled into a mash. After filtering the solids through a linen cloth, the sugary liquid is boiled and hops are added, both for flavouring and as a natural preservative. Once the boiling is complete, the beer is put in barrels where the yeast is added. A short time later, the beer is ready!    Visitors can sample the beer at cellar temperature, the way it was enjoyed in the past, or drink a chilled pint in the pub, the way many people prefer it today. Either way, you’ll be tasting the authentic flavours of ales and porters made by hand, using only natural ingredients and genuine period recipes.    Visit the Black Creek Historic Brewery. It’s interesting. It’s fun. And the beer is great!

description: Deep in the heart of rural Roscommon, in the village of Ballinlough, a brewery grows. Brewing without boundaries, Black Donkey Brewing, a concept that has come of age, has finally found a place to call home. Traditionally cautious animals, this Donkey is not one to shy away from turbid mashes, spontaneous fermentation, wood ageing, smoked malts, coolships, or anything else we can come up with, to bring you the best, and most diverse, beers we can make. Production began in mid 2014, bringing Irish, European, American and historical brewing influences together under one roof, and onto the rapidly growing and increasingly exciting Irish craft-brewing scene.

name: Black Dragon Brewery
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday-Thursday 11-7:00pm, Friday 11-9pm, Saturday 10-9pm, Sunday 10-5pm & Closed on Mondays

name: Black Duck Brewery
description: Based in Port Macquarie, the Black Duck Brewery offers a friendly, relaxed venue to try the range of locally brewed beers while you catch up with friends and family or just enjoy your break.   With the full range beers on tap, local food platters, local produce, and much more to come, the Black Duck Brewery is a must visit destination on the Mid North Coast.  Spend some time, meet the brewer, do the tour and experience the Black Duck Brewery.    To ensure satisfaction, all the Black Duck Brewery beers are   brewed and packaged on site. We do occasionally carry another small brewery's beer on tap to both support them and give you another beer experience.    Non beer drinkers can enjoy some Apple Cider, a glass of local wine, some local soft drink or even a deliciously well crafted locally roasted coffee.    The Ploughman’s platters are popular with a generous serve of   local beer bread, ham, olives, relish and a few other tasty goodies.  The brewery hours are 10am to 6pm Thursday and Friday, 10am to 4pm Saturday and Sunday.     You can find us at 6B Acacia Avenue, Port Macquarie.  You can give the brewer a call on 0407 874 474 if you want to know more.   Give us a call if you have a group and want some nibbles to ensure we have plenty.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 10:00 am - 6:00 pm  Sat - Sun: 10:00 am - 4:00 pm

name: Black Forest Brew Haus
description: The Black Forest Brew Haus is the end result of two great countries combining their greatest attributes. Germany’s rich history and excellence in beer brewing -and consumption- combined with America’s ongoing pursuit for perfection have made us an award winning brewery with a menu to please all palates.    Black Forest’s mother company, Privatbrauerei Hoepfner of Karlsrue, Germany has been brewing since 1798 and shares its knowledge & tradition with the Black Forest Brew Haus including materials, recipes and equipment. All Black Forest beer is fresh brewed on our premises using only the finest imported yeast, hops, malt and the purest filtered water.     Our brew master uses modern technology and respect for German tradition to produce award winning beer for our customers, and creates new recipes that will excite even the most jaded of beer connoisseurs. This is what sets the Black Forest Brew Haus apart from all other brew pubs.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:30 am - 11:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:30 am - 1:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Black Heart Brewery
description: We are Black Heart Brewery; we are a home brewery located in Binghamton, New York, and we are in the process of becoming a nanobrewery. Coincidentally, these web pages are in the process of becoming our website. We are overhauling the whole thing, adding much more content, as well as many more new sections.     Black Heart Brewery was founded many batches of home brew ago between two high school friends, Brett Martin and Jay Maslar. See what happens when you seat people in alphabetical order? We currently brew 10 gallon all grain batches on our custom, hand made heat exchange recirculating mash system; it is named HERMES. It is capable of fully automated brewing and extremely accurate data display and recording with our cutting edge Brewtroller 4.0.

name: Black Heart Brewery
description: Black Heart Brewery are producers of exceptional hand-crafed beers. From our signature Weizen with it's polarising taste, to our Dunkelweizen with it's light and dark complexity, these aren't your average beers.

name: Black Hog Brewing Company
description: Black Hog Brewing started with the story of food, family, and a love for craft beer. Brothers Jason and Tom Sobocinski come from a Polish/Italian family where food and drink is always the focus of every gathering. From Jason’s wedding to his son’s birthdays, roasting a pig has become the favorite way to celebrate any special occasion. Tyler Jones, an old family friend and former brewer of The Portsmouth Brewery in New Hampshire, contacted Jason and Tom with a plan to move to New Haven so his wife and son could be closer to their family. With a plan in the works to form a brewery that would celebrate family and food, they needed to encompass all that they were passionate about. When they celebrate, they roast a hog and the Berkshire hog is the breed of choice, thus Black Hog brewing was born!     Black Hog Brewing (BHB) will have a strong tie to local agriculture with a focus on unique craft brews that are pleasant to drink and pair well with foods of all types. Black Hog Brewing will craft year round and seasonal brews with a seasonal Farm Land Series dedicating a percentage of proceeds to support CT Farm Land. 3-4 pig roasts per year, using CT raised Berkshire pigs fed our spent brewing grains will celebrate the release of our seasonal brews. We hope you’ll enjoy Black Hog Brewing Company at one of our pig roasts soon or whatever occasion brings you together for great beer and food with friends and family.

name: Black Hole Beer Company
description: Our Taproom features a modern yet casual atmosphere where can enjoy a rotating selection of fine craft beer, wine, homemade sangria, whiskey, as well as some light fare. We will be offering special events and live music. Our beautiful outdoor area will feature a covered 12 foot farm table, covered standing bar area, bocce ball court, darts, gas and wood burning fire pits, and a relaxing garden.     We are so excited to announce the arrival of Harley Guy as our new Gastropub chef at the Blackhole taproom. The new menu is focused on seasonal homemade food with a unique point of view. Stay tuned for updated menu items.

name: Black Husky Brewing LLC
description: Making the world a better place one beer at a time, and to promote the joys of jodeling. Hoping to one day have a reality show called "Jodeling with the Stars."

name: Black Lotus Brewing Company
description: Mark Harper, Michael Allan and his wife Jodi Allan (Mark’s sister) founded Black Lotus Brewing Company in 2006.  Their family business formed when Mark (a school psychologist and musician) and Mike (a financial planner and banker) both longed for more creative and spiritual control over their careers.  Disheartened by massive corporate entities serving up inferior products, Mark and Mike, together with Jodi (a high school educator) created the philosophy: “Think Global, Drink Local. “    Under this philosophy Black Lotus is committed to providing quality-handcrafted products to each and every one of its customers.  Furthermore, these products are to be served to the customer with timeliness, friendliness and individualized care.   In addition, Black Lotus is committed to the notion that this care should be extended to the community at large and the world when possible.  This is accomplished by supporting charitable contributions and activities that bring the world more creation, more compassion, more art, more tastefulness, and more peace.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:30 am - 1:00 am  Fri - Sat: 11:30 am - 2:00 am  Sun: 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm

name: Black Market Brewing Company
description: Black Market produces high-quality, handcrafted beer.    HUMBLE BEGINNINGS. ALWAYS GREAT BEER.  A small budget, tight resources, and big goals are what Our first brews were made out of at a small warehouse that was, more realistically, a large garage. On that small 1 bbl brewing system we pinned our dreams and created the much-loved Hefeweizen.    FINEST QUALITY INGREDIENTS, FRESHEST QUALITY RESULTS  With big dreams for a mircobrewery, Black Market opened to put Temecula, California on the map with a commitment to use only the best malt, hops and yeast­, all selected by hand to ensure quality.  The results were award-winning products with a reputation for craft excellence.    GREAT BEER FROM WINE COUNTRY  As one of Temecula’s first craft breweries, Black Market introduced locally brewed beers to the community. Now found far beyond Temecula, Black Market beers are on shelves and in establishments throughout Southern California, Arizona and Washington.    LEADING A MOVEMENT  Like many craft breweries before us, we have followed stories of those who came before us. We’re proud to have launched the movement in Temecula, to keep inspiring the next waves of great beer with our success, and to continue to lead through our quality process, experimental hop releases, and innovative beers.

name: Black Mesa Brewing Co.
description: An Oklahoma City Brewery, striving to create world class beers. Thank you for supporting Craft Beer and making the choice to drink local!

name: Main Location
description: For Crazy Ed Chilleen, beer was too important to be trusted to outsiders, so, in 1989, he started brewing his own. The beer was good, that the yuppies started driving in from all over to try it. Something had to be done! So, whenever one of them whined for a wedge of lime, Ed put a hot serrano chili pepper into the beer instead. Amazingly, many of them actually liked the stuff.

name: Black Oak Brewing Company
description: Established in 1999, Black Oak makes great tasting, slow brewed, all malt, authentic hand crafted beer that's true to style. Both our delicious Pale Ale and Nut Brown Ale are gold medal winners in the national Great Canadian Brewing Awards. All our beers focus on Quality, Character and Consistency.
hoursOfOperation: Monday – 11 am to 5 pm  Tuesday through Friday – 10 am to 5 pm  Saturday – 10 am to 3 pm

name: Black Raven Brewing Company
description: The Black Raven is a true neighborhood brewery with a small retail taproom. We are the Eastside’s home to world-class, small-batch brewed ales & lagers. We also feature a continually changing hand-picked selection of other notable Washington State beers. And most importantly, home to local beer lovers who want to be a part of a community that enjoys great beer and great friends.

name: Black Sheep Brewery
description: Since 1992 Black Sheep Brewery has been brewing fantastic beers in the heart of the Yorkshire Dales.

name: Black Shirt Brewing Company
description: An artisanal brewing company that combines classic and timeless technique coupled with progressive innovation and unwavering commitment to quality to create the very pinnacle of beer. Our hand-crafted, hand-bottled beer will be available in fine restaurants and select retail establishments soon.

description: The idea and the name were first thought of back in 2007 and incorporated in 2010. Dominating Beer and Coffee Since Yesterday!

name: Black Star Co-op Pub & Brewery
description: With a special focus on local producers, the basic mission of the Black Star Co-op is to foster an environment in which member-owners, as well as the general public, may realize the principles of co-operative ownership, worker self-management, education and community action through the responsible enjoyment great beer and food.    As the first enterprise of this type, we seek to realize an alternative business model for brewpubs and to help expand the co-operative movement into new and innovative areas — both in Austin and around the world.

name: Black Swan Brewpub
description: From the start, Black Swan Brewpub has been driven to provide its customers with a unique culinary experience, delicious beers and warm hospitality.    Our chef, Nick Carter, has taken the dishes we know and love and incorporated freshness, originality and homemade goodness that cannot be found today in Southwest Indianapolis.    Soon, Black Swan Brewpub will have our brewery in place. In the meantime, while construction is underway, we will be serving a spectacular draught selection of craft beers, many of which are made right here in Indiana.

name: Tap Room

Bomber Mountain Amber  Indian Paintbrush Ale (IPA)

name: Blackberry Farm Brewery
description: Tucked away on Blackberry Farm's 4200 acre estate in the foothills of the Great Smoky Mountains, Blackberry Farm Brewery produces classic Old World - style beers - each one artisan-crafted and bottle-conditioned.

name: Blackfoot River Brewing Company
description: Blackfoot River Brewing Company was founded in 1998, and began producing their line of handcrafted beers in January of 1999. The Brewery is located in the heart of historic Downtown Helena and near the headwaters of both the Big and Little Blackfoot Rivers.    The founding partners established the brewery to produce the finest, handcrafted, traditional beers to be found in Montana. All Blackfoot River beers are brewed with the highest quality traditional 2-row malts, hops, and yeasts, individually selected to produce each particular style of beer. Each of our specialty beers are carefully handcrafted 14 barrels at a time. Blackfoot River's beers are never pasteurized, normally unfiltered and are available exclusively on draught.    Blackfoot River Brewing was founded and is operated by three partners:    Brian Smith -Head Brewer and General Manager  Greg Wermers - Off-Premise Sales  Brad Simshaw - Brewer and Regulatory/Tax Manager    Fourteen barrel, three-vessel, steam-fired brewhouse  (3) Fourteen barrel fermentation vessels  (5) Fourteen barrel conditioning/bright tanks  (3) Seven barrel conditioning/bright tanks  Packaging: draft  Capacity:1,850 barrels (annual)

name: Blackfriars Brewery
description: Opened in 2004, award winning Blackfriars Brewery brought brewing back to Great Yarmouth, Norfolk 36 years after the closure of the famous Lacons brewery

name: Blackhorse Pub and Brewery
description: When The Blackhorse first opened in 1992, our goal was to provide that neighborhood Pub atmosphere where “everybody knows your name.” Since then we have strived to provide the food, service and atmosphere that would make people want to come back. Today the Blackhorse Pub and Brewery has grown into a mainstay in Historic Downtown Clarksville known for fresh brewed, handcrafted beers, gourmet pizza, steaks and other favorites. Clarksville has many casual dining restaurants today. But, there is only one locally owned brewpub serving the freshest handcrafted ales brewed on site daily right in the heart of downtown Clarksville.

name: Blackjack Brewing Company
description: A craft brewery in Raleigh, NC

name: Blacklist Brewing
description: Break the Big Beer Model! Beer brewed with quality, creativity and culture in mind. See our 2013 beer offerings, to the right, and look for our upcoming Kickstarter Campaign for details.    Blacklist is a year long project that meshes local artisans with beer and the brewing process to create fun and unique collaborations. Featuring a different artist and brew each month, we bring you a drinking experience worth sharing and talking about. Available in VERY limited quantities for pick-up in MN only. Look for further details on our upcoming kickstarter.com campaign. Til then, Skal, and stay thirsty for new beers.

name: Blackrocks Brewery
description: At Blackrocks Brewery our mission is to have fun and brew great beer that challenges conventional norms. We offer you a wide variety of beers and rotate them regularly. The Blackrocks experience is: local, unique, and diverse.    Some say we are limited by our small size. We look at it a little differently, located in an old four square house, the brewery and tasting room compliment the small nature of our operation. The setting lends a neighborhood feel and harkens back to a traditional public house where people can meet and play chess or debate politics.

name: Blacksburg Brewing Company
description: Blacksburg Brewing Co. (BBC) is an independent specialty brewer of premium beer.  As mandated by the Reinheitsgebot (German Purity Law), our beer is brewed with only 4 ingredients: water, barley malt, hops, and yeast.  The best beer requires the best ingredients, so we purchase them regardless of the cost.  We pay a premium to import the Cadillac of barley malt from Bamberg, and our hops from The Hallertau are the best that money can buy, period.

name: Blacksmith Brewing
description: The building that houses Blacksmith Brewing Company was built in 1908.  It began as a steam laundry and later became a Blacksmith shop. With every brand the blacksmith made he would then burn it into the wall to make sure it was perfect. It took a great vision to see what it could become, and a lot of hard work. For seven months we labored, and opened on Oct. 25, 2008. The brands still stand to show testament of all who passed this way.

name: Blackstone Brewing Company
description: Blackstone Restaurant & Brewery was established in 1994 and was the first brewpub in Nashville. In 2011 we expanded as Blackstone Brewing Company when we opened a brand new state of the art brewery in Nashville.
hoursOfOperation: Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM  Monday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM  Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM  Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM  Thursday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM  Friday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM  Saturday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM

name: Blackthorn Cider
description: The year was 1972 and a crack team of West Country master cider makers were tasked with making a new West Country cider to beat all others.     After months of blending and many a late night tasting session, Blackthorn cider was born. The West Country know their cider, and The West Country liked it.     Word quickly spread and Blackthorn rapidly grew to become one of Britain’s most popular ciders and one that remains true to its West County roots.     Shepton Mallet, in the heart of the West Country, is the home of the Blackthorn cider mill. It’s here that we’ve been making cider for over 50 years. The team that oversee the process have over 100 years  of cider making experience (this is between them, they’re not really that old).     We are also the biggest employer in Shepton Mallet and over 90% of our fruit comes from within 50  miles from here. We have long term relationships with 68 local growers from Somerset, Devon, Dorset and Herefordshire where all the finest cider apples come from.

name: Blackwater Brewing Company
description: The Blackwater Brewing Company is a family owned company. The company was formed in 1998 as a natural growth of a sole proprietorship, beginning with approximately four employees. Today we employ 13 local residents and continue to provide a family friendly environment for our patrons. The original owners, Terry Lee and Rosalinde Benson, continue to manage the daily operations here at Blackwater Brewing Company. Blackwater Brewing Company is currently divided into two divisions: food & beverage operations, and malt beverage brewing operations.

name: Blank Slate Brewing Company
description: Blank Slate is one of the many new small craft breweries in the Cincinnati Ohio area. Launched in 2012 they are part of the growing renaissance of craft brewing in Cincinnati.    Blank Slate unlike many breweries, produce primarily seasonal brands. This means that many of the brands will be rotated several times throughout the year. This philosophy to forego the "flagship model" of beer branding and embrace the seasonal approach to beer brewing (and drinking) is a big part of the Blank Slate mantra.

name: Blatant Brewery
description: Blatant beers are exceptional. That much is clear from the taste alone.   Here’s what makes us world class:    Blatant beers are forceful, but never forced.   These beers are dynamic and creative.   We work with the brew on its own terms, nurturing and developing its unique personality.   Anybody can throw together an average brew.   Only a true artisan can craft a flavorful and vibrant drinking experience.   No shortcuts. We pay extra attention to what goes in.   We smell, taste and study each of our choice ingredients.   Our brews are born of passion.   Obviously, a love of brewing is the first ingredient in a brew worth loving.     Blatant is new. We aren’t.   We have been in the brewing business for many years—this experience, time and energy spent has earned us a reputation as talented brewers and true artisans.     Yes, our beers are handcrafted.   Yes, we are brew artisans.   And yes, we've got well over 20 years experience in every keg, bottle, and can. But let’s face it: In the end, all that matters is the taste.     Be Blatant!

name: Blind Bat Brewery
description: A one-man, part-time, 3 barrel brewery. The brewery is young, the brewer ain't!

name: Blind Squirrel
description: The Vance Toe River Lodge was originally built in 1919 as the T. B. Vance General Store. After trading hands through the years and seeing its fair share of abuse it was renovated by the Young family and continues to evolve.  With that evolution came the expansion of our  “Lodge Family”.  When Aaron Maas moved to Plumtree, NC in 2009 as an avid home brewer, the dream to open a brewery slowly moved towards reality.  After 3 painstaking years, the brewery finally opened in July of 2012.  We are excited to be able to live in such a wonderful place and still have the ability to follow our passions.  Come out to Plumtree so we can prove to you that we’re nuts about beer!!
hoursOfOperation: Wednesday & Thursday - 11:00am- 8:00pm  Friday & Saturday- 11:00am - 10:00pm  Closed Sunday

name: Blind Tiger Brewery & Restaurant
description: We opened the first brewery in Topeka since the Prohibition era.   It is named after the Prohibition era custom of displaying stuffed tigers in establishments to alert patrons of the availability of bootleg alcohol. These speakeasies were referred to as “Blind Tigers.”   We keep at least six flagships and seven rotating seasonals on tap, to the tune of about 1200 barrels a year. Our brews have gathered 20 national and international awards over the past 14 years.  Our Brewpub is located at 37th & South Kansas Avenue.

name: Block 15 Brewing Company
description: We brew with the finest organic base malt, in combination with top quality imported specialty malts and Northwest grown hops. On tap you will find at least 12, sometimes up to 14 of our own brews representing a fine spectrum of beer styles. On average we have a new beer on tap every 1-2 weeks, recreating classic styles and developing our own unique brews as well.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Thu - Sat:	11:00 am - 1:00 am  Sun:	11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Block Three Brewing
description: GREAT THINGS COME IN SMALL BATCHES…    At least that is what we believe here at Block Three Brewing Company. Brewed in-house, our small batch brews give us the ability to create new recipes while maintaining the classics.    As locals, we have pride in our community and have learned that a great product starts with the right ingredients. As a result, not only do we brew an all-natural product, we keep our ingredients as local and fresh as possible. Nothing is more important to our team than providing our community with quality craft beers.    Brewed right in St. Jacobs, we put the same artisan craftsmanship into each and every bottle we package and we look forward to seeing you soon!
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Tue: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm  Thu: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm  Sun: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm

name: Brewpub @ Lennies
description: Philosophy—  Life without labor is guilt.   Labor without art is brutality—John Rusgan    There is a nearly infinite variety of ways to make good beer. At the Bloomington Brewing Company, we make beers that we like to drink. That’s the first rule. Great ingredients and attention to detail is the second. Our intention is not to grow a large brewery operation, our intention is to make great beer that we like to drink and to take care of our community.    We make only ales and they are available only on draft in Bloomington, Indianapolis and the surrounding communities. We do not bottle our beers. We’re not against bottling, and we will assuredly reach a point in the future where we will package our beer, but no matter how good a beer is in the bottle, it can never be better than the beer coming from a well managed tap. Often it will be not nearly as good. Why? Draft beer is fresher; that’s a big one. Packaging beer is a complicated process with lots of potential for bad things to happen. Once packaged, the beer is exposed to its two mortal enemies; Sunlight and time.
hoursOfOperation: Sun - Thurs: 11:00 a.m. - Midnight*  Fri - Sat: 11:00 a.m. - 1:00 a.m.*  *Restaurant closes 1 hour earlier.

name: Blowing Rock Brewery
description: The Blowing Rock Brewery and Ale House Restaurant is located in downtown Blowing Rock. A state-of-the-art brewing system consists of a 5 barrel Mash Tun, Brew Kettle and 10 barrel Fermenters & Brights . The brewery offers an impressive variety of craft beers brewed by master brewer, Ray Hodge. The Blowing Rock Ale House restaurant offers a freshly prepared, seasonally changing menu using local & organic ingredients when available. 64 ounce “growler” fills of freshly brewed beer are offered daily, with brewery tours 1:00-5:30pm Saturdays. We hope you will join us for lunch & dinner, 11am-9pm.    152 Sunset Drive  Blowing Rock, NC 28605-1236  Telephone: 828-414-9600   http://blowingrockbrewing.com/

name: Blue and Gray Brewing Co
description: The Blue & Gray Brewing Co. opened in Fredericksburg on March 17, 2002.  Before that, Fred Red Ale and the Blue & Gray Classic Lager were brewed at other  microbreweries in Virginia. We listened to customer input and perfected our recipes  before we started brewing in Fredericksburg. Blue & Gray Brewing Co. now offers Falmouth American  Pale Ale and Stonewall Stout for a total of four flavors year round. We also offer Spiced  Winter Ale for Thanksgiving through January, Chocolate Raspberry Stout for January-February and  Virginia Hefeweizen Memorial Day through Labor Day.

name: Blue Bali
description: Originating from Lock Road at Gillman Village The Villa Bali has bought in its joglos, lesehans and other Balinese paraphernalia. Affectionately known as Little Bali, we left behind our iconic Majapahid Gate, a legacy of the tragic bombing of Bali on 12 October 2002.   Our Mission – Providing a dining and entertainment experience that allows people to commune with nature, relax, de-stress and be happy. By bringing nature and the Bali culture of service into the living or dining space our guests can experience the ultimate environment to chill-out, dine and entertain their friends and family.

name: Blue Bee Cider
description: Virginia’s first and only urban cidery, Blue Bee Cider is located in the heart of downtown Richmond’s Old Manchester district at the fall line of the James River. The name for Blue Bee Cider is derived from a common name for one of Virginia’s native bees, osmia lignaria, or the blue orchard bee. These hardworking bees are solitary and wild, emerging early in the cool spring just in time to pollinate apple blossoms.    At Blue Bee Cider, we aim to create balanced ciders true to their Virginia roots from a culinary perspective and true to the fruit from a cidermaking one. Each apple variety ferments differently, creating its own flavors which vary year to year depending on weather conditions. Blue Bee Ciders are never chapitalized (it’s so sunny in the South, who needs to add sugar?) and never watered down. We use raw juice and ferment it straight off the press.

name: Blue Blood Brewing Company
description: Blue Blood Brewing Company is a new craft brewery to Lincoln Nebraska. The day to day operations are run by Brian Podwinski with the help and support of family and friends.    All of our wonderful ales will be named with a three or four digit number simply because numbers are easy to remember. Every beer will have a reason it is brewed and a person who inspired the beer. We feel having inspiration for our beer helps us make even better beer!    Please Consume Our Products Responsibly!!!

name: Blue Corn Cafe
description: Blue Corn Brewery is a mid sized brewpub in Santa Fe New Mexico. All the beer at Blue Corn is brewed on a one manned 7 barrel brew house. There are four 7 barrel fermenters and one 15 barrel fermenter. The 15 barrel is used exclusively for the Road Runner IPA, our most popular beer. Our Head Brewer, John Bullard uses the finest ingredients from around the world to make a wide variety of ales and lagers. Blue Corn Brewery has 6 house beers and 4 rotating specialty beers. Blue Corn Brewery also specializes in Northern New Mexican cuisine.

name: Blue Diamond Brewing Company
description: Premium Handcrafted Beer by Blue Diamond Brewing Company of Minnesota use only the highest quality hops, grain and yeast to brew its craft beer - because of these high quality ingredients, we can guarantee you a premium hand crafted product with a consistent taste that you deserve and respect.

name: Main Meadery
description: The oldest beverage on earth just got a facelift. No longer are viking wannabes and medieval enthusiasts the only people who get to knock back a glass of the original liquid sin. Now it’s your turn.    Mead has been around longer than any other drink on the planet, so we’ve had plenty of time to perfect the recipe. Blue Dog Mead is concocted with honey instead of grapes, making it a sweet, refreshing alternative to wine. Not to toot our own horn, but we think with one sip you’ll be hooked.    Our newly designed bottles are made to move, and we don’t just mean off  the shelves. We mean to the beach,in a backpack or while watching a game. You’re mobile and active, so why shouldn’t your drink be? No gimmicks here. Blue Dog just wants to go with you as you grab the   leash and take life for a good long walk.    So leave history to the vikings and the books, grab yourself some Blue Dog Mead and let’s explore the future of this brand spankin’ old drink together.

name: Blue Frog Grog and Grill
description: Blue Frog is committed to producing traditional ales and lagers with a non-traditional twist. We use only the best ingredients to hand craft our balanced food friendly beers. Brewmaster Nick Campbell constantly tastes each batch to ensure its consistency and quality, leaning no beer released before its time. That’s commitment to quality.
hoursOfOperation: Mon-Thu 11:30 am - 10 pm  Fri-Sat 11:30 am - 11 pm  Sun 11:30 am - 9 pm

name: Blue Heron Brew Pub
description: Blue Heron BrewPub, located in the historic Parkin Place, offers the best in pub dining and finely hand crafted, locally brewed beers. Open for lunch and dinner daily*, the BrewPub offers a delightful selection of appetizers, sandwiches, salads, and hearty entrees. If you can't stay, you can arrange to "take out" your order. **    Our beers are brewed by Corey Nebbeling. Corey, who brews exclusively for Blue Heron BrewPub, hails from Michigan. While in college, Corey started brewing for his own pleasure, experimenting with different beer styles and recipes. He was an assistant brewer at the Lander Brewing Company in Lander, Wyoming for a year and then joined Short's Brewing Company in Michigan. Under Corey's direction, we are proud to continue our signature beers, Honey Blonde, Tiger's Eye, and Loch Ness Scotch Ale. Additional beers, such as RYEzome Red, Hub City Lager, Witz End Wheat, and Oktoberfest will continue to rotate through our 10 taps. In addition to these, Corey will be offering a wide variety of newly crafted beers for your tasting pleasure.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	11:00 am - 12:00 am  Fri - Sat:	11:00 am - 1:00 am

name: Blue Heron Brewing Company
description: From Pale Ale to Stout and from Porter to Pilsner, brewing beer  is our passion and as a family we're dedicated to bringing  New Mexico the finest brews.

name: Blue Hills Brewery
description: Beer is our life! Blue Hills Brewery makes great tasting beers inspired by the elements and nature around us; embracing the rich history of the Blue Hills and the South Shore. We do this not only for ourselves but, for our friends, neighbors and visitors to the Boston and South Shore areas. name: Boston Beer Company
description: Today, we're a team of about 750 people, and we all share a common passion for bringing great Samuel Adams beers to beer lovers everywhere. We've worked hard and are incredibly proud of the many successes we've enjoyed over the years. The Boston Beer Company has been cited as one of the best companies to work for by Boston Magazine, one of the Best Entry-Level Jobs by The Princeton Review, and our beers have won more awards than any other in history. Jim has been named an "Entrepreneur of the Year" by Inc. Magazine. Our brewers keep amazing us with innovative new brews, including Samuel Adams Utopias and our Samuel Adams Barrel Room Collection.    Jim has believed from the beginning that the more you know and understand about beer, the more you'll appreciate a beer like Samuel Adams Boston Lager. To begin that mission, all new employees go through intensive training on everything from ingredients, brewing, and beer styles, to taking care of the beer once it leaves the brewery. We're all beer lovers and protectors of the beer so we're trained how to identify off flavors and how to troubleshoot the causes. The passion for beer continues with an annual homebrew competition that we all take part in.    One of our wholesalers once asked Jim why he invested so much in training his people, when ultimately they might leave. Jim smiled and replied without hesitation: "What if I didn't train them, and they stayed?"    Each year, usually in January, everyone gathers together. One of the highlights of the meeting is the beer trivia contest. With a culture so steeped in beer education and knowledge, winning is a pretty big deal. Recently, one of the hotel bartenders who was watching as the various teams arrived in costume with music and much enthusiasm and fanfare, said, "I've always known Samuel Adams made the best beer in America, but now I see this is the greatest company in America." When you look around you see that The Boston Beer Company is a team of enthusiastic people who are passionate about beer and who really love coming to work every day to provide American drinkers with the best beer possible.    The Boston Beer Company, Inc. is a publicly-traded company listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol, SAM.

name: Boxcar Brewing Company
description: Boxcar Brewing Company is a community-oriented brewing company providing fine crafted beer to be enjoyed with family and friends.  The idea for Box Car Brewing Company originated in 2006 in Tennessee at the wedding of two of its chief members Jason and Kristen Kohser. In the mountains of Tennessee gathered a very small group of friends and family including Jason’s cousin Kymberly and her then boyfriend Jamie Robinson. After an intimate ceremony, the entire group enjoyed a reception complete with homemade guacamole and a tub full of crudely marked “homebrews” prepared by Jason. Prior to this, he had been working in high-end restaurants as a general manager, bartender and food server for over 20 years. He spent several years in Northern California learning the fine art of winemaking at a local winery in Sonoma. During this time Jason realized the beauty of brewing beer and his desire to share his creation(s) with others. He’s been brewing out of his kitchen sink for several years now, slowly perfecting his recipes, offering to teach others the art, and, most importantly, making and drinking some real good beer. Jamie, who has yet to find a brew he will not try, immediately was interested in Jason’s creations and quickly started picking his brain on the processes and formalities for creating these “homebrews”. While sucking down a few well-crafted brews in the hot sun, Jamie and Jason talked about their love of beer and the groundwork was laid.    A few months later, Jamie received a phone call from Jason, who had been mulling over the possibility of moving forward with the beer making, he then proposed the idea of moving to Pennsylvania. Jason asked if Jamie would be interested in working together and the dream of opening a brewery was declared. In 2007, Jason and his wife moved to West Chester, PA where many of his family live. Together with the other three members the idea was hatched to get serious and start brewing beer on a larger scale, for the beer lovers in Chester County, PA. Box Car Brewing Company became a reality.

name: Brasserie D'Achouffe
description: Towards the end of the 1970s, Pierre Gobron and Christian Bauweraerts (two brother-in-laws) decided to create their own beer in their own brewery.   With initially only a small amount of money available to them (200.000Bfr, less than 5.000€), they started out on what the fans of the brewery call the ‘Chouffe story’.     At the beginning its founders thought of it as a hobby, but the brewery developed at such a rate that, one by one, they decided to devote themselves to the adventure full-time. The first ‘brassin’ (brewing mix) of LA CHOUFFE (49 litres) was finished on 27th August 1982.    The elves of Achouffe were impatient to discover new countries, and their Dutch cousins were the first to give them a warm welcome. Even today, the Netherlands is the major destination of Achouffe Beers outside Belgium. Nowadays, more than 20 countries worldwide are supplied with our ‘nectar’ from the Ardennes forests. Coveted international awards have also been received year after year to reward their unique taste. name: Brasserie de Brunehaut
description: In 1890 the Allard family founded the Brunehaut brewery in Guignies, then called the St Joseph Brewery. It became known in the region for brewing beers like "La Druide" and "Brunehaut 8°". In 1991 the company took on a new challenge and moved into modern buildings while maintaining its traditional character and the quality of its products, qualified as "grand crus" by connoisseurs. An alliance of Modernity and Tradition!  These are the company's motto, a real creed for the managers at Brunehaut Brewery.    Tradition, because the traditional brewery retains the entirely natural brewing method for late fermentation beers and that are refermented in bottles and kegs. The result: a panel of about a dozen abbey or organic beers, all valuable and unique. To ensure that the link to the region remains strong, the types of barley used in the brewing process are grown in our own farm at Gaurain-Ramecroix.    Modern, because modern and high performance machinery ensure scrupulous compliance with hygiene regulations and a top quality production with consistent flavour. Also modern in how we deal with the market: several beers from Brunehaut won prizes at international competitions and are currently present in 25 different countries.  Marc-Antoine De Mees and his staff are still equally enthusiastic to allow the discovery of this knowledge and method.…

Since 1950, the brewery Dupont is specialized in the production of high fermentation beers fermented in the bottle. Its most popular products are Moinette blonde and Saison Dupont .     since 1990, part of the production is brewed under license and carries the biological Biogarantie ® label: biological Moinette , Biolégère , organic honey beer ... name: Brauerei Reissdorf
description: During the period of promoterism – at the end oft he 19th century – the breweries in Cologne sprang up like mushrooms. In this era the PRIVAT-BRAUEREI HEINRICH REISSDORF – then called OBERGÄRIGE BRAUEREI HEINRICH REISSDORF (TOP-FERMENTING BEWERY) – was founded in the Cologne quarter “Severinsviertel” in 1894. Its founder, Heinrich Reißdorf, derived from an old-established farmer family who were based in Zieverich – today a quarter of Bergheim/Erft – as farriers and coach builders. A few years later, in 1905, the name Kölsch was established for the top-fermented Cologne beer-speciality. Before, it was called “Wiess”. After Heinrich’s death on 25.02.1901, Gertrud Reißdorf managed the brewery until 1908. The continuance of the company had never been in danger, though, since the Reißdorf couple had five sons, Johann Hubert, Heinrich, Hermann, Friedrich and Carl Reißdorf.    When the product range was diversified to further styles of beer – Märzen, Export (both a strong variation of Lager) and Pilsen – in 1923 the top-fermenting brewery was renamed to BRAUEREI HEINRICH REISSDORF – OHG. In 1917, when the men had gone fighting in World War I, Friedrich’s wife Katharina managed the brewery. The two had three sons: Heinrich Reißdorf, who was killed in an accident in the brewery in 1936; and the two proprietors Hermann-Josef and Karl-Heinz, who died in 1996 and 1997. They led the company through economically difficult times after World War II, when the brewery was destroyed to the extent of 90%. Against all odds, the two brothers managed to produce and bottle a “Einfachbier” (literally: simple beer) with 2-4% vol. alc. Today the business is continued in the fourth generation.    Due to a prosperous development of the PRIVAT-BRAUEREI HEINRICH REISSDORF, a new site for the brewery had to be found within the boundaries of the city of Cologne. Therefore, the company purchased premises in an industrial park in Cologne-Rodenkirchen. With the new production facility, a brewery with most modern brewing technology was built, which meets the highest quality criteria.    Continuity and a sense for the necessary are the virtues which make possible to look back on 110 years of an existing PRIVAT-BRAUEREI HEINRICH REISSDORF. The ongoing success and the positioning of the PRIVAT-BRAUEREI HEINRICH REISSDORF in the highly competitive Kölsch-sector confirm this corporate philosophy imposingly.
